choices: Veny the slime girl of the swamp
Nekia the cat girl of the forest
1.content:
The world of Galeran had always been terrorized by monsters but a few years ago something changed. Portals opened letting in hundreds of monsters of much greater size, but these monsters were different, they took the form of giant women. They immediately took to terrorising the world of Galeran. Your name was Alex Feralclaw and you were a nobody, but not for long. If you could get one or more of these monsterous women on your side you could seize power easily. You could become a king in no time flat, the only problem was where to begin. You looked over the information you had gathered on the nearby monsters one last time.

         Veny the Slime girl of the swamp was an intelligent slime that grew in size the more magic she consumed. Her last documented size was about 25 ft tall. Her amorphous body let her change shape and color at will, easily trapping many explorers. While she didn't care for the taste of meat she did pose a constant threat to the wizards that depended on the trade routes through her swamp. With every shipment she took she grew a couple feet and rendered all the magical ingredients and instruments she touched inert.

         Nekia the cat girl of the forest was a 50 foot menace to the south. She treated the merchants carts like play things, chasing them down and bating them around. She was extremely intelligent as well, she quickly learned the trade routes and how the merchants might avoid her, she even set traps to make sure they couldn't get away. With her on your side you could easily take down major trade routes.

         Haliera the Dragon queen was a huge dragon to the far East of the kingdom. Like most of the new monsters she would be difficult to tell apart from a human female if it weren't for her size and extra features. In her case she was 100 feet tall with wings, horns and a dragon tail. Like all ancient dragons she was proficient in magic and as the dragon queen she commanded an army of 10 foot dragon girls. Every month her dragons would raid a random kingdom and steal as much treasure as possible.

         Mersila the sea tyrant was a 300 foot merwoman. She was causing trouble for the fishermen by eating all the fish around the dock to the west. Her size and strength let her easily break open fishing nets and consume her meal. Some fishermen disappearances were blamed on her but more often than not She seemed to eat fish. With her helping you could take out an entire Navy fleet.

         Desia the colossus was the largest known monster in the world standing at 2,000 feet. She is currently hibernating to the north with her back to the village, making her long red hair and behemoth sized booty easily visible. She wasn't known for being aggressive but the hard part would be getting her attention and convincing her to work with you afterwards. Desia's raw power could easily help take control of kingdoms alone but there were also some religion's forming around her, with a colossus and an army of fanatics at your side you could easily conquer a country.

         After reviewing all the information one last time you decided to go after...
1.title: Your legend begins

11.content:
You decided to start with Veny the slime girl of the swamp. You gathered what little of things you could call yours and set off for the swamp she nested in. On your way out of the village a cloaked figure stuck out their foot and tripped you. You landed face first in the dirt with their laughter filling your ears. "Going somewhere Alex," they said cackling.

"Screw off Merl," you said as you lifted yourself back up.

"Why don't you make me, oh right you can't you flunked out of the Academy," Merl said with her annoying sarcastic voice. You began walking away again only for Merl to appear once more dead ahead of you. "Seriously where are you going Alex, were going to need you when one of those monsters asks for an offering."

"I'm going on an adventure Merl, you and your precious Academy will be lucky if you never see me again," you said pushing her aside and continuing on your trip. There was another reason Veny was your first choice, with her ability to consume magic she could set Merl and everyone else at the Academy of Magical Arts to the same level as you.

         You reached the swamp just as the sun was beginning to set. You pulled out the one magical item you had in your bag, a endless ink quill supplied by the Academy. You ventured into the swamp quill in hand looking for any signs of the shape shifting slime. Then it happened, tendrils of translucent ooze shot up from the swamp grabbing and restraining you. They pulled the quill from your hand and released you. Looking up you saw a beautiful 25 foot female with translucent black hair and pale skin standing in front of you. The quill was floating inside of her where it glowed for a moment before being shot out of her, she grew a few inches right in front of you. She gave you a smile before turning around and walking away.

"Wait," you yelled but she kept on walking like she couldn't hear you. "I...I can get you more," you said desperately.

"More?" She said curiously as she turned around.

"Yes more, see your on a small trade route but if you go to the source you could consume a lot more magic," you explained. She looked at you with a confused expression on her face. "Do you understand?" You asked

"Trade?" She said confused before pulling a frog from the water and offering it to you.

"No no trade, it's a gift. I can take you to it follow me," you said as you began to walk back to your village.

"Gift," she said as you felt her stuff the frog into your pocket. It sent shivers down your spine as you felt it squirming in your pocket.
11.title: Veny the slime girl of the swamp

111.content:
As you walked you pulled the frog out of your pocket and released it into the swamp. "No like?" Veny asked curiously noticing your actions.

"No no I like it but we can't take it with us," you said making excuses. The magic Academy wasn't to far from the swamp, you were actually a little surprised she didn't know about it. You two reached the edge of the swamp and began to head back to the village. You could see the Academy at the peak of the mountain next to the two of you. "We have to go up," you said to her pointing to the Academy.

"Up?" Veny said curiously as she picked you up and raised you into the air.

"Higher," you said pointing again to the Academy above you.

"Up" Veny said happily as she threw you high into the sky. You crashed through one of the Academy windows and landed on one of the desks. You took a minute to compose yourself and make sure none of your bones were broken, before walking back to the window.

"Now you come up!" you shouted to Veny. She smiled before walking up the side of the cliff like it was nothing. She squeezed her head through the broken window and then proceeded to squeeze into the room. She looked around the room hungrily, seemingly sensing all of the magical instruments.

"Gift?" She asked with drool dripping out of her mouth.

"Yes gift," you said gesturing to the room. Without hesitation she sprang into action, tendrils shooting from her body and grabbing every magic object in the room. She opened the door and reached into other area's of the school as well, it was less than a minute but you were pretty sure she had already managed to grab every magical item in the Academy. They glowed inside her and she began to grow right in front of you. She grew and grew until she was...
111.title: She follows you

1111.content:
Veny doubled in height right in front of you becoming at least 50 feet tall. You were backed into the corner of the room in order to avoid her. She turned to smile at you once more now that she had finished. "Can you become smaller?" you asked her.

"Small...er?" She asked curiously.

"Yea like my height," you said gesturing to yourself. She looked at you confused for a second before a look of realisation spread across her face. You watched her body condense in on it's self, becoming less and less translucent as she did so until she looked like a normal girl. She was still a foot or so taller than you but it would be easier to get her out of the academy now that you could guide her. You brought her out of the room and down the hallway you watched as small tendrils shot out of her and grabbed magical items she had missed, draining them and spitting them out. The two of you soon reached the exit and as you opened it you were shocked to see Merl standing there looking at you. Her purple eyes stared into your soul as she said, "oh Alex what a surprise, I thought you left for good. Out for a late night study session with your girlfriend are you? You know the teachers don't like it when students trespass at night don't you?"

"Sorry Merl we were just getting things ready for tomorrow," you lied as you tried to get past him.

"Gift," Veny said cutely as she placed the slime covered frog in Merl's hand.

"Right," Merl said monotonously as she crushed the frog in her hand. Rage burned in Veny's eyes as she absorbed Merl into her body sucked her dry of magic and through her towards the ocean all in only a few seconds. She had grown a full foot from that move and was still in her condensed form.

"I think we're going to be good friends," you said with a smile.

"Friend," she said softly as you took her hand and led her to your home. You passed out when you got home and awoke to the startling sight of Veny staring down at you, her green eye's piercing the depths of your soul.

"Uhh... Veny?" You asked wondering what she was doing.

"Friend," she replied cutely as she lifted you from the bed with one hand. You were about to put together breakfast when you heard a knock at the door. It was Merl, surrounded by the Academy teachers and soaking wet. You stared at them for a second in total silence before closing the door. There was a loud bang as one of the wizards blasted the door open.

"Veny, it's time to go," you said in a panic.
1111.title: Yeet

choices: You get her to calm down
Veny absorbs the magic of the entire village
11111.content:
Veny's arms quickly extended into tendrils that grabbed and covered each of the mages at the door. She grew as she drained the mages of their magical power. She looked at you with a big smile and asked, "Good?"

"If we survive this I promise I'll teach you how to use complete sentences," you said trying to make light of the situation.

"Promise?" Veny asked as she gave you a cute look. Her attention snapped back to the mages whose backup had just arrived. She released the now drained mages and grabbed the new ones that had just charged in.

"You'll regret this Alex," Merl shouted as she ran away from the fight.

"We'll see," you said feeling as though you had won.

"More," Veny said as her eyes seemed to fill with hunger, she grew more and more into her full height. Screams could be heard as people saw her grow. Now transparent again Veny was standing at a hundred feet tall, tendrils shot from her body grabbing any citizen in sight and absorbing what magic they had. She was growing quickly, 120 feet, 130 feet, 150 feet, as she grew she was able to cover more ground and grab more people growing faster. She released those that she drained back on to the ground, now completely void of Magical energy.

"Ok Veny time to stop," you said just before a tendril shot from her and grabbed you. Veny was towering over the village at 200 feet. She released everyone she had drained and turned around to drain another part of the village. You could here them screaming as she grabbed them. If you couldn't reason with her she was going to absorb all of the magic in the village.
11111.title: Veny absorbs the mages magic

choices: You manage to avoid being caught by her
She catches you and keeps you as a pet
12.content:
You decided to start with Nekia the cat girl of the forest. Her intelligence and stealth would make her a valuable ally. You packed up what little you had and started heading south. A few hours into your journey you found a trading wagon flipped on it's side with the horses missing. You spotted some gigantic foot prints next to it and began to follow them.

         The prints led to a clearing in the forest where you could see the monster you were after. Aside from her size, extra pair of cat ears and feline tail she looked like a normal human girl. She had Burnett hair, green eyes, decent breasts and a large rear end. Her clothes appeared to be made from various leather and cloth she had stolen from the merchants. You watched in horror as she picked up a horse and ate it like a cat does a mouse. Realizing this was a terrible idea you turned to run away and you stepped on a twig.

"Oh, what's this, another knight to try and vanquish me for the good of the people?" She asked easily spotting you.

"No... No actually I was here to ask you a question but it looks like your busy so I'll be off," you said nervously.

"Oh I'm not busy ask away little mouse," she said with a smile.

"Well... I was wondering if you would like to team up with me," you said shaking in your boots. Nekia burst out laughing for a solid minute.

"Is that so... And what could you possibly have to offer me," she said gleefully.

"I know all of the trade routes from the village north of you."

"I don't need those, I get enough food with the trade routes I know already, but you are funny. Tell you what little mouse, well play a game if you can avoid being caught by me until the sun sets over the horizon we can be friends, but if I catch you I'm going to do whatever I want to you," she said licking her lips. "I'm only going to give you a one minute head start so you better get going."
12.title: Nekia the cat girl of the forest

choices: You chat with Nekia all night long
Nekia wants to play a new game
121.content:
Without wasting a second you ran straight into the forest, making sure to go through bushes and step on rocks and tree stumps to avoid leaving foot prints. "Your times up here I come," Nekia shouted from the distance. There was no way it had been a minute yet, Nekia was trying to cheat you into becoming her next meal. You could see her cat ears poking over the tree tops as she came running in your direction. You could see a river not to far away so you made a break for it. "There you are," she said teasingly just before you jumped into the lake. You dove underwater and swam upstream, a shadow loomed above you and you swam harder against the current to escape her. Just when you saw giant fingers pierce the waters surface next to you, you made your move. You flipped over and swam with the current instead of against it, getting a good view of Nekia's butt as you swam away.

         You quietly broke the surface of the water as she pulled out her hand triumphantly. "Got you, huh, where did my mouse go?" She continued searching upstream for you while you slowly and quietly got out of the stream. You were going to hide until the sun set, then you stepped on another twig. "There you are..." Nekia said as she turned to face you. You ran through the trees as fast as you could, hearing them crash behind you as Nekia broke them down chasing after you. Then her fingers closed around you, it was over she had caught you.

         She brought you up to her face and looked at you with glee. "That was the most fun chase I've had in a while," she said happily looking down at you. She pointed to the now sunless horizon before continuing with, "and it looks like you lasted just long enough to be my friend." You sighed in relief as she placed you between her breasts and began walking back to clearing where you had met her.
121.title: A game of cat and mouse

1212.content:
Nekia returned to the clearing and curled up on the ground. "I'm going to sleep, don't do anything you'll regret little mouse," she threatened as she closed her eyes.

"It's Alex," you corrected her.

"Whatever," Nekia said with a yawn. You considered getting out to make your own campsite but the cold wind of the night just made you want to stay in the warmth of her bosom. Nekia looked much cuter while she wasn't eating a horse like it was a light snack. You drifted off peacefully within your new giant friends cleavage.

         You awoke to some large object rubbing against your head. Opening your eyes you saw a large finger petting your head. "Your pretty cute little mouse," Nekia whispered to you. "Your different too, most mice try to fight or run from me. Your the first to try and be my friend. I don't have much experience with friends but I'll do the best I can."

"Thanks, but please call me Alex," you said to her. She jumped at the sound of your voice.

"Your awake," she said clearly caught off guard.

"Yeah, weren't you trying to wake me up by petting me?" You asked confused.

"Oh... Yeah duh of course I was," Nekia said blushing.

"... You thought I was asleep didn't you."

"Nope, come on little mouse let's get some breakfast," she said getting up off the ground.

"It's Alex, a good friend would remember her friends name," you said smugly.

"Don't push it," she said taking you out from between her breasts and setting you down on the ground. "Start a fire, I'll bring you back something to eat." You listened to her and began assembling some large stones into a circle. Then you gathered some wood from the wagon that led you to Nekia the other day. When Nekia came back she dropped a large fish into your hands.

"What about your food?" You asked her.

"Oh I ate the rest of them," she said as she took a seat and watched you begin to cook the fish. "So little mouse, why do you want a monster for a friend?"

"It's Alex, my name is Alex Feralclaw and I'm tired of my village calling me a good for nothing loser. With your help I can prove my worth and make a name for myself," you said confidently.

"Your an ambitious one little mouse-"

"Alex"

"Whatever don't interrupt me, I kinda like you but I'm not going to take orders from you. If I do something it's because I wanted to, not because anybody else told me too," she said sternly.

"Sure that's the great thing about monsters, you don't listen to anyone unless it benefits you. Tell you what I'll go home today and tomorrow I'll bring back something you won't find out here in the forest. Then you'll have a reason to help me, because we can call it a trade," you said already knowing you were going to bring her...
1212.title: Nap time

choices: "Let's move to a different trade rout"
"So how many other monsters are you keeping track of?"
12121.content:
When you went home you sold most of your belongings and bought pastries from the local bakers. With a sack full of pastries you set out to see Nekia the next day like you promised. You got some odd looks from the villagers but it wouldn't matter in the end. You smiled as you saw the familiar wrecked wagon in the road. You walked into the clearing, Nekia was taking a nap in the middle.

         You set down the sack before going and touching her nose. She jerked her head back surprised, taking a look at you she relaxed, got up and stretched. "So what is it that you decided to bring me?" Nekia asked happily as she brought her head down to the ground.

"These are called pastries, our bakers make them almost every day. They go stale sooner than it takes for merchants to traverse this trade rout so I doubt you ever get them." You said holding one out to her. She opened her mouth and waited for you to put it in. Remembering how she devoured the horse, you decided to toss the pastry in rather than get your hands close to her mouth. You could immediately tell by her face that she loved it.

"Mmmm, these are great, you said that the bakers make them?" She said as she emptied the sack of sweets into her mouth.

"Yep and we can get more if you help me, it'll be our deal, you help me and I'll get you pastries," you said.

"Deal, what do you want first?" She said excited to have more pastries. You saw this coming, she wanted to do something now to get them as soon as possible, the problem was you didn't have any money left. You took a minute to think before responding to her saying, "there's a trade caravan coming in from the east, if you scare them away then their goods should be able set us up for a while."

"That sounds easy enough," Nekia said as she got up, grabbing you as she did so. She began to head east with you in her hand, keeping her head low so that people wouldn't spot her from a distance. She peeked over the trees every so often to check if she could see the caravan, until finally she spotted it. She set you down on the ground before running in through the trees at breakneck speed. "Oh great lunch has arrived!" She shouted off in the distance. You could hear the commotion as the horses scrambled to avoid her. You began making your way over, you could hear the panicked cries of the people as they tried to escape with what they could.

"Leave the goods, save yourself!" One of them yelled.

"Awww, running away? I just need something to eat," Nekia said. As you approached the edge of the road you could make out the scene in front of you. Some of the horses had broken free of their harnesses, some of the people were trying to ride away and Nekia had two of the horses in her hand. One of the wagons was trying to make a U-turn and get away, but Nekia was easily keeping up with it. "Where do you think your going?" She asked playfully. Giving in the merchants abandoned their wagon and tried to run away. Nekia easily took another one of their horses as they ran off.

"You did pretty good," you said as you began to rummage through the abandoned caravan.

"Thanks, it's pretty easy when your a fifty foot monster. So how many pastries do you think this can buy?" She asked smugly as she ate one of the horses.

"It can't all go to pastries, were going to need supplies," you responded.

"Supplies for what?"

"You've been terrorizing the same trade rout for awhile, they'll be hiring protection soon, probably wizard's because most weapons are ineffective on you. If you want to stay alive you'll either need help or to switch trade routs," you explained.

"What kind of help?" She asked.

"There's a slime girl that can eat magic, she would be the most obvious option." You said collecting the money and valuables from the loot. Nekia thought to herself before saying...
12121.title: Pastries

choices: She locks you in a cage
13.content:
With Haliera's resources you could easily take whatever you needed to ensure your name was written in the history books. You packed what little you had and started to your journey east. You gave the village one last look before continuing the long trek east. You couldn't wait till everyone knew the name Alex Feralclaw.

         Two days of walking later and you had reached the castle Haliera had cleared out and made her nest. You watched as hundreds of dragon girls flew out and went north. You were in luck, today was raid day so she would be alone. You began to scale the side of the castle, once you reached the top you almost last your grip from the sight you saw. A beautiful girl with jet black hair, grey demon like horns, red dragon wings and tail, massive breasts and a butt to match was laying on a bed of gold and jewels.

You climbed on top of the wall and shouted to her, "excuse me miss Haliera I have an offer for you!" She calmly got up, took two steps towards you, sat down and leaned in close. Her head was looming over you, her face completely expressionless.

"Are you an idiot?" She asked staring at you.

"Well no... I don't think so," you responded

"We'll see about that, what is your offer."

"I can help you get much more gold."

"What do you gain from this?"

"In return you help make me a king," you responded. She continued looking at you emotionlessly as she thought to her self until finally...
13.title: Haliera the dragon queen

choices: You pass out from the heat
She finds a new way to torture you
You give in and submit to her
132.content:
Haliera chuckled as she picked you up and said, "why would I make you a king when I can just make you my prisoner." She stuffed you into a square iron bar cage and blocked the door with a large piece of the castle wall. "Now how do you suppose, you could get me more gold?" She asked looking down at you from outside of the cage.

"Well if you won't help me I won't help you," you said confidently. Haliera frowned at you then turned around and slammed her big booty on top of the cage. The roof bent inwards from her weight nearly breaking under it.

"That was a warning, if your not careful the next one will kill you," she said coldly threatening you.

"Do you really want me dead, I could help you make this whole operation a lot more efficient.

"Your very confident for someone so small."

"Nah your just big," you said pretending to be confident in your position.

"Your the first human not to beg for mercy... Perhaps you need more convincing," she said coldly. She got up, turned around and began to breath fire over the now dented cage. The heat from her flame was already starting to make you sweat. She continued breathing fire, only stopping to take breaths. She was either going to cook you into a meal or one of you was going to give in.
132.title: She locks you in a cage

choices: Have you spend some time as her spy first
Decide your more trouble than your worth
1323.content:
You lost track of how long she had been torturing you with her fire breath. You were drenched in your own sweat and you were starting to see doubles. "Alright, I give in," you said in defeat. She stopped and looked at you, waiting for you to disclose the information you posses. You panted between breaths as you explained, "You've been targeting kingdoms randomly each month but if you raid selected kingdoms at specific times and intervals they will have more gold for you to take. For instance the kingdom of Vander gets large shipments of gold and jewels in on the first of every other month as payment due to it's exports."

"Interesting," Haliera responded actually looking impressed. "And is it like this for other kingdoms as well?"

"Yes and no, I can explain but can I get some water first?" You asked still sweating. Haliera spread her wings and took off into the sky. The gust of wind from her wings flapping was like a cool breeze. A few minutes later she came back with cauldron in her right hand and her left clenched into a fist. She opened your cage and set the cauldron inside, and then re-barricaded the door with the rubble. She hovered her left hand over the cage, opening it she released a fist full water (for a 100 foot giantess). The water flooded the cage, shoving you against the side and completely filling the cauldron. You got up drenched from the flash flood she just and began drinking from the cauldron, using your hands to get it into your mouth.

         After drinking enough water to feel rehydrated you told her everything you knew about the trade routes of various kingdoms and their schedules. She listened intently to each and every word that came out of your mouth. Once she saw you were finished talking she spoke up and asked, "now then, do I have any reason to keep you alive?"

"Yes you do, when the kingdom's realize that you know their schedules they will change them. You need me to observe them and report back to you. Sure your dragonlings could do it but they will be easily spotted, and will cause disruption," you said to her confidently once more.

"Their wyvern's, completely different species," she said clearly upset by your misinformation. "We work together, they bring me gold and I refill their mana because they are incapable of regenerating it."

"Whatever, why correct me if you plan to kill me?" You asked

"I suppose I could use you as a spy, but what guarantee do I have that you won't run away the first chance you get?"

"You could agree to help make me the king of my own kingdom," you suggested.

"I think I'd lose more gold than I'd make and it doesn't seem nearly as useful as a spy," she said.

"Not necessarily, Kings have a responsibility to know the goings on of other kingdoms. It would actually be easier for me to be your spy as a king because I would have spies and informants of my own."

"Wouldn't the other kingdoms become suspicious?"

"Not if you raid mine too."

"How do you expect to have a prosperous kingdom if your raided constantly?"

"Your the first monster I've tried to make a deal with but not the last one I plan to do so too. If you help me convince some other's you could have a powerful spy and some other monster's to help you accumulate more gold." You said to her hoping to finally convince her. She thought about what you said before deciding too...
1323.title: You give in and submit to her

choices: She decides to play with you
14.content:
You packed what little you had and set off to the docks, unlike the other options this one wasn't too far away from the village. You untied one of the abandoned boats at the dock and began rowing out to sea. This was Mersila's favorite feeding ground so she would surface here eventually. You waited for hours board out of your mind thinking about what to say to her.

         Finally it happened the boat began to rock, you looked over the side just and saw a bunch of seaweed rushing towards you. Your boat was raised into the air, you looked down and saw your boat was now resting on a giant head of long green hair. You saw a bunch of water be shot out like a geyser from her back. You heard her take in a deep breath and stretch, "hmmm, what's this?" She asked as she easily picked up your boat and brought you to her face. Her sky blue eyes looked at you curiously, her skin was smooth instead of scaly like you expected.

"Oh uhh, hi there miss," you said nervously.

"Miss? You know im a monster right?" Mersila said with a giggle.

"Well that's no reason to be impolite," you sad jokingly. She laughed and gave you a big smile like you were an old friend.

"Your not like the others are you? What is it you want... What's your name?"

"I am Alex Feralclaw and I would like to make you my partner," you said confidently.

"Partner? That sounds fun but what do you have to offer me?" She asked as she gently touched you with her pointer finger.

"Well I've heard the fishermen talk about their plans to get rid of you, we can make sure none of those come to fruition," you said looking her into her massive eyes.
14.title: Mersila the sea tyrant

141.content:
"Get rid of me? They know I just want to eat my fish right?" Mersila asked a little hurt.

"They blame you for the disappearance of several of the fishermen and your known for eating the fish they caught in their net's," you explained.

"Well it's their fault for packing such a delicious meal in one place," she said pouting, "besides I never eat people, they taste way worse than fish."

"I don't think you'll be able to make them listen to you with that argument, especially because your known as the sea tyrant"

"Tyrant? I always saw myself as more of a princess," she said pouting again "So what do you think I should do?"

"The fishermen are planning to use the enchanted harpoons by the docks to hunt you down like a whale. Once they penetrate your skin you won't be able to submerge. If you break them now they won't be able to hunt you like they wanted to."

"That's a pretty good idea um... I'm sorry what was your name again?"

"It's Alex... Alex Feralclaw," you said with a bow, much to her amusement. She began to walk to the docks with you still in her hand. She rose more and more out the water as she approached the docks, by the time she got there only her feet were still submerged under the water. She gently set your boat down on to the docks and said, "alright Alex, go get those harpoon's for me and I'll snap them in half." You did as she said, it was the dead of night so you didn't have to worry about people seeing Mersila or anything.

         One by one you assembled the enchanted harpoon's and brought them back to Mersila who snapped them like twigs. When the two of you had finished broken harpoon's littered the dock. Mersila picked you back up so that you were back in the palm of her hand. "The sun will rise soon, you should probably come with me so that you don't get caught," she said happily as she walked back into the ocean with you in hand.

"Don't you live under the sea?" You asked.

"How long can you hold your breath?" She asked with a smile

"About a minute."

"That's long enough," she said as she closed her fingers around you and submerged. You held your breath as water rushed by you. About a minute later she surfaced again, but this time instead of sky you saw a cavern lit by glowing moss. "Isn't it great, I think there's a hole somewhere to let in air from the surface so you can stay here as long as you like," she said as she set you down on the ground. You looked around in amazement at the beautiful spacious cavern that Mersila called home. The floor was covered in sand from the beach that she must have brought here herself. The water Mersila was swimming in looked like a small pond on the edge of the cavern.

"It's beautiful," you said.

"Thank you," Mersila said as she got out of the water and stood tall in the cave. Her head was about 50 feet from touching the roof of the cave. You were now able get a good look at her body in the light of the glowing fungus. Her body was physically fit, she had shark like fins on her arms and legs and her green hair looked almost like seaweed.

"So what should we do?" You asked her.
141.title: Mersila's secret hide out

1413.content:
"Let's get you settled in," Mersila said with a smile as she sat down on the ground and began to play with the sand.

"What are you doing?" You asked confused.

"You'll see," she said with a giggle. She was building up the sand with her hands, getting it wet and letting it dry. It didn't take long for you to figure it out.

"Are you building a sand castle?" You asked politely.

"Yep, this will be your room... Even though it is technically part my room," she said as she masterfully crafted a 20 foot tall sand castle with only her hands. When she finished she picked you up and placed you on the inside. The sand castle was about 40 square feet with no roof and a single archway pointing towards the water. There was a ramp to let you go up and walk on the walls if you wanted, but other than that it was surprisingly barren. As if reading your mind Mersila said, "I know it's not much to look at, but I have big fingers so if you want more you'll have to add it yourself."

"Thank you Mersila, it's pretty much perfect, I just need a place to store my thing's," you said as you approached on of the walls and started to carefully carve out a small space. You didn't make anything fancy, just enough to put your soaking wet bag in, you were lucky that nothing important would be destroyed by the water damage. Mersila watched you with a smile, her legs wrapped around the sand castle.

"Your my first human friend, you know," she said as she brought down a finger to gently rub your head. "Even as far as monster friends go none of them really help me out."

"Are they really friends then?"

"... I guess not, but there the closest I have."

"How often do you talk to each other?"

"Fine your my first friend, is that what you wanted to hear?" Mersila asked rhetorically as she playfully knocked you over with a smile. "I'm going to sleep through the day, I suggest you do so as well because there's something I want to show you tomorrow night," Mersila said as she got up and laid down across from the sand castle. The next night Mersila showed you...
1413.title: Mersila's castle

choices: She begins to move in her sleep
15.content:
You packed up your things and got ready to move out. All of your options were basically suicide if you failed so you might as well make the most insane play first. Desia wasn't likely to kill you on purpose but it was going to be hard to wake up what was basically a walking mountain. You could see her body in the distance, bathing in the starlight. It was a long and boring walk, you reached the ends of her hair just as the sun began to rise.

         It was risky to scale her hair so you took a chance and went under her. Luckily the ground she was using as a pillow was a bunch of hills, leaving just enough space for you to crawl between her head and the ground. You were pretty sure that you could see her ear in the distance. You began to crawl your way over to it, you felt like you were crawling into an unexplored cave. After about 15 minutes of crawling you reached the back of Desia's ear but it was flush with the ground and there didn't seem to be a way around.

         You began to dig into the rough earth, after another 30 minutes or so of digging you finally cleared enough space to squeeze yourself under her ear. You looked up at the massive ear canal above you and realized just how massive this woman was. Her ear canal was like a massive cave you, if you could get her to like you than you would be unstoppable. You took in a deep breath and shouted up to the heavenly body that was Desia, "Wake up, I'd like to talk to you!"
15.title: Desia the colossus

choices: Have a wizard enchant her so she could hear you from a distance
Steal a magical device to let her shrink at will
151.content:
Desia yawned as she awoke from her slumber. "Why would someone wake me a week early," she asked in a booming voice as she looked around. Finally her green eye's looked down and saw a speck waving at her. "A human? That's a first, what do you want speck?" She asked as she set her massive finger down in front of you. You climbed on top of her finger and held on as she brought it up to her ear.

"I'm here to make you an offer," you said confidently.

"An offer? There really isn't anything humans can offer me, what is it you think you have that I want?" She asked.

"Well for starters how about friendship?" You asked.

"Friendship? Why should I be friends with someone so small that I could kill them on accident?"

"Well I'm guessing you don't have many friends due to your size. When was the last time you spent some quality time with someone?"

"... Look your not wrong but if you were my friend you'd basically have to live in my ear f you wanted me to hear you."

"So your saying if I found a way for us to communicate better you'd be willing to be my friend?"

"Sure," she said with a giggle. "But why do you want to be friends so badly?"

"My village thinks I'm a good for nothing loser," you said to her. "But with you as a friend I could prove them wrong."

"If your seeking vengeance you should know I don't kill anyone on purpose," she said sternly.

"Then I won't ask you to."

"Then let's see what a loser can do, you have a week before I awake again. Bring whatever it is you think can help us talk to valley by my feet when I awake," she said as she carefully set you down on the ground away from her and laid back down. You already had a plan you were going to...
151.title: Friendship quest

info.brief_description: Assemble your harem of giant monster girls and use them to make a name for yourself
info.description:
Rules
No sudden or surprising death of the main character.
Make sure additions are actually readable.
No one sentence chapters.

Other than that go crazy

I reserve the right to edit/delete chapters that break the rules
info.pretty_title: The Giant Monster Girls of Galeran
